page.title: 05PENISTONE TOWN HALL.
page.content: Penistone Town Hall built in 1913 is a red brick building with a slate roof and window frames made of York stone. The windows in the council chamber cotain stained glass. There are two public entrances off Shrewsbury Road. Part of the Town Hall is used as a cinema. The original planns of the building are on the wall in the council chamber alongside the photographs of old council members. Penistone Town Council has fifteen members, including the mayor. They meet on the third Monday of each month and deal with local matters which they can bring to the attention of the Borough Council.
